column4: hello i have a Pesky Package which cannot be removed, and I can't install anything else while it exists. The package is bnetd
And I get this error: grep: /etc/bnetd/bnetd.conf: No such file or directory
Please help 감사해
what are you trying to do? Can you paste full shell output?
Sure
using dpaste.com or so
http://dpaste.com/211970/
I have tried removing it several ways, until, in my anger, I deleted /etc/bnetd
So the error is slightly different to what it was before
looks like a bug to me :-) I'd file it... Will you? Try apt-get install --reinstall bnetd; apt-get purge bnetd.
It does look that indeed. Someone else on the internet had an identical problem with bnetd, and they solved it by getting the latest bnetd .deb and installing that. However, that did not work for me
Try apt-get install --reinstall bnetd; apt-get purge bnetd.
Same errors
Where can I file this to? And is there some crazy, dangerous, risky way that I can kill this package?
hm. weird. Then I'd just do mkdir /etc/bnetd; touch /etc/bnetd.conf; apt-get purge bnetd :-)
let's try a sane way first ;-) To file a bug, do "ubuntu-bug bnetd".
The problems were around before I deleted /etc/bnetd though
Is it still worth filing a bug now that the error code is different because I got rid of /etc/bnetd?
I'd say so.
So I guess the next step is to reinstall?
have you tried mkdir /etc/bnetd; touch /etc/bnetd.conf; apt-get purge bnetd ?
and? what's the output? success?
